bibl.title: Two Ptolemies in Alexandria
bibl.note: Alexandria, Graeco-Roman Museum, Inv. 28163 (granite, 17,5 cm, from Canopus) and P. 1798 (limestone, 30,4 cm, from Ras el-Soda). The 2 heads sculpted in the Egyptian manner represent Caesarion.

bibl.title: BSAA â€“ Alexandrian Studies II in Honour of Mostafa el Abbad

bibl.seg: STANWICK Paul Edmund, Two Ptolemies in Alexandria.
Alexandrian Studies II in Honour of Mostafa el Abbadi = BSAA 46 (2001) pp. 51-57, 4 figg.
Alexandria, Graeco-Roman Museum, Inv. 28163 (granite, 17,5 cm, from Canopus) and P. 1798 (limestone, 30,4 cm, from Ras el-Soda). The 2 heads sculpted in the Egyptian manner represent Caesarion.
